intro: Rauvolfia chaudocensis, commonly known as the African snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by elliptical, berry-like fruits. Its roots contain alkaloids, which have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Rauvolfia chaudocensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
